intro: Burmannia carrenoi, commonly known as the red-flowered burmannia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as swamps and marshes. Its leaves are usually broad and have a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered. Burmannia carrenoi plays a role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for various pollinators.
